meanings.definition: Indicating the onset of a disease or illness
meanings.sent1: The prodromic symptoms warned her of the approaching flu.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recognized the prodromic signs of the infection.
meanings.sent3: His prodromic cough made everyone around him take extra vitamin C.
meanings.sent4: The prodromic clouds in the sky hinted at an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The prodromic fever burned like a flickering candle, signaling trouble ahead.

meanings.definition: Serving as a warning or precursor
meanings.sent1: The prodromic headache alerted her to the stressful day ahead.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds were prodromic of the impending rainstorm.
meanings.sent3: His prodromic yawn indicated the boring lecture to come.
meanings.sent4: The prodromic silence in the room foreshadowed an argument.
meanings.sent5: The prodromic smell of smoke hinted at a fire nearby.

meanings.definition: Characterized by early symptoms or signs
meanings.sent1: The prodromic rash appeared before the full illness.
meanings.sent2: Her prodromic fatigue signaled the start of the flu.
meanings.sent3: The prodromic sneeze caught everyone's attention in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The prodromic chill in the air foretold the coming winter.
meanings.sent5: The prodromic ache in his joints warned of the arthritis flare-up.
